alert.note: Alert for City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 2:35PM EDT until June 23 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The City of Norfolk in southeastern Virginia... The East Central City of Portsmouth in southeastern Virginia... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 235 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Old Dominion University, Ocean View, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Norview, Ghent, Norfolk NAS, Norfolk International, Wards Corner and Willoughby Spit. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth
